intro: Elephantopus martii, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems and lobed leaves. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Elephantopus martii is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
